questions.question: Which of the following creates a valid list in Python?
questions.explanation: Lists use square brackets [] and can contain mixed data types.

questions.question: What happens if you try to change an item in a Tuple?
questions.explanation: Tuples are immutable. Any attempt to modify them will result in a TypeError.

questions.question: Arrange these list methods by their function (Append, Insert, Pop):
questions.explanation: append() adds to the end, insert() adds at a specific position, and pop() removes the last item.

questions.question: What is the index of the first item in a Python list?
questions.explanation: Python uses zero-based indexing. The first item is at index 0.
